channel.title: Diagrams and visualizations on open-archaeo
channel.description: Recent content in Diagrams and visualizations on open-archaeo

item.title: Analysing Stable Isotope Data
item.description: Tutorial on how to visualise, analyse and interpret stable isotope data

item.title: archeoViz
item.description: A packaged R ‘Shiny’ application for the visualisation, interactive exploration, and web communication of archaeological spatial data.

item.title: Ceramic-Frequency-Date-Plot
item.description: This R script produces a exploratory visual for assessing site date ranges originally suggested to me by Wesley Bernardini Redlands University

item.title: Ford-Diagram
item.description: This R Function creates a simple Ford diagram for archaeological seriation with error bars determined based on sample size were count data are given

item.title: geoCore
item.description: Constructs a graphical representation of petrographic drilling profiles.

item.title: IsoDataVis
item.description: Data visualization guidelines for stable isotopes graphs, with examples

item.title: IsoMapNL
item.description: Data and script to generate a map of the Netherlands for isotopic analyses

item.title: Isotope-Visualisation
item.description: Resources relevant to visualisation of isotopic results

item.title: khroma
item.description: Colour Schemes for Archaeological Data Visualization

item.title: MapofComputationalArchaeology
item.description: Visualizes digital archaeology as a fantasy landscape.

item.title: munsell
item.description: Provides easy access to, and manipulation of, the Munsell colours

item.title: munsell-plot.R
item.description: Make a stratigraphic-style plot-schematic of sediment colour using munsell values

item.title: osteoGIS
item.description: Plot data on skeletal templates quickly

item.title: Plotting Dental Inventory with ggplot2
item.description: tutorial on an intuitive way to visualise a dental inventory in a sample
